clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Mainly used to treat patients in vasodilatory shock states such as septic shock and neurogenic shock and has shown a survival benefit over dopamine Also used as a vasopressor medication for patients with critical hypotension

contraindications.disease: In high dose and especially when it is combined with other vasopressors it can lead to limb ischemia and limb death
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Noradrenaline acts on both alpha 1 and alpha 2 adrenergic receptors to cause vasoconstriction Its effect in vitro is often limited to the increasing of blood pressure through antagonising alpha 1 and alpha 2 receptors and causing a resultant increase in systemic vascular resistance
